title: National Rebirth Alliance
text:
The National Rebirth Alliance (, ARN) is a <a href="Right-wing%20politics">right-wing</a>, <a href="Christian%20right">Christian</a> <a href="Conservatism">conservative</a> <a href="list%20of%20political%20parties%20in%20Romania">political party in Romania</a>. The party's main values are <a href="Christianity">faith</a>, <a href="Family%20values">family</a>, and <a href="education">education</a>.
History.
The party was formed in 2019 by renowned layer and <a href="Coali%C8%9Bia%20pentru%20Familie">Coaliția pentru Familie</a> figure, Peter Costea, and his supporters after he failed to enter the <a href="European%20Parliament">European Parliament</a> as an <a href="Independent%20politician">independent</a> in the <a href="2019%20European%20Parliament%20election%20in%20Romania">elections held earlier that year</a>. The relatively new and small party grew in popularity by taking a very <a href="Anti-abortion%20movements">pro-life</a> attitude, hoping to unite all anti-abortion movements in the country under its leadership.
Ideology.
The party is defined by its predominant <a href="Christian%20values">Christian values</a>, most notable being its <a href="Anti-abortion%20movements">pro-life</a> and <a href="Family">traditional family</a> policies. According to Peter Costea, the right to life is the most fundamental human right and seeks to review the Romanian abortion law, saying: "If we discuss the laws for the euthanasia of animals, why not discuss the granting of personality to the unborn?". The law is deemed by him as being illegitimate as it was issued in 1989 by the <a href="List%20of%20members%20of%20the%20National%20Salvation%20Front%20Council">National Salvation Front Council</a> in the midst of the <a href="Romanian%20Revolution">anti-communist revolution</a>. The party also opposes <a href="same-sex%20marriage">same-sex marriage</a>, as well as <a href="Anti-gender%20movement">gender ideology</a>, or any form of <a href="sex%20education">sex education</a> for children in schools. Peter Costea aims to open for the first time a real debate on what he calls "non-negotiable principles" in Romania.
